required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anesthetic Efficacy Of 4% ArtpharmaDent Versus 2% Mepecaine-L in Extraction of Lower First Primary Molars
clinical_study.official_title: Anesthetic Efficacy Of 4% ArtpharmaDent Versus 2% Mepecaine-L for Infilteration Anesthesia in Extraction of Badly Decayed Lower First Primary Molars: Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: parallel technique will be done where the investigator (will be blinded) will give one type on anesthesia then performing the extraction and evaluating the intraoperative pain ,the same procedure will be done for the other type of anesthesia.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: intraoperative pain will be measured using wong baker pain scale,The scale shows a series of faces ranging from a happy face at 0, or "no hurt", to a crying face at 10, which represents "hurts like the worst pain imaginable". Based on the faces and written descriptions, the patient chooses the face that best describes their level of pain Face

clinical_study.condition: Badly Decayed Lower First Primary Molars in Children

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged 6-8 years.
- Medically fit (ASA I, II).
- Mentally capable of communication.
- Having a mandibular first primary molar tooth that require Extraction.
- Child must give assent prior to participation, as well as parental informed written consent.
- Body weight >20 kg.
- it should be the first dental treatment to the child
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medically and mentally compromised children.
- Children without a history of prolonged bleeding, platelet disorders, hypersensitivity,
- History of significant behavior management problems.
- Patients having active sites of pathosis in the area of injection.
- Patients who had taken analgesics or antibiotics in the 12-hrs preceding the injection.
- Patients allergic to Articaine and/or Mepivacaine and/or sulfur
